Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery plate preserving complete profile; low ring foot. Reddish fabric with slip. Hook meander frieze on top of rim; banding with some added red at edge of floor; set of three leaves preserved in centre. On edge of rim, frieze of large dots with added red; three bands on upper wall, one lower down; outside of foot painted. Part of one suspension or repair hole preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 4, N 12)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 41, no. C. 1f)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (II D, p.5, pl. 2, no.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.769)
